title.narrative: Expanded Support for Durable Resettlement and Reintegration in Sri Lanka

description.narrative: The armed conflict in Sri Lanka has brought about the forced displacement and formation of a significant refugee population in India. Since 2011, over 2,000 individuals have received facilitated return from India back to Sri Lanka. Along with those who chose to migrate through irregular pathways, returnees face debilitating challenges such as lack of livelihoods and lack of access to essential protection services, which have been exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic and can be a trigger to relapse into conflict situations. To address these issues, IOM and UNHCR the project will enable sustainable reintegration of migrant and refugee returnees to former conflict affected areas. The targeted intervention increases returnees’ access to livelihood options and income generation opportunities and provide psychological support through increasing organizational capacity of community-based organizations, providing refugee returnees with support to access housing and protection services, and increasing local government officials’ knowledge and skills in providing the aforementioned services.
